## Risk
[Describe the risk, including context and how it was identified.  
Provide relevant background, observations, audit findings, or triggers.]

## Initial Evaluation
[Describe what could happen if the risk occurs.  
Consider effects on quality, compliance, continuity, customer satisfaction, or process performance.]

- **Severity:** [Low / Medium / High]  
- **Likelihood:** [Low / Medium / High]  

## Planned Treatment / Actions
[Describe planned actions using the risk response options: Mitigate, Avoid, Transfer, Accept.  
If mitigation or avoidance is chosen, summarize the intended approach. Include responsible role(s) and any required process changes or external coordination.  
Reference any new issues created under the Change Control process.]  

## Monitoring & Review
[Explain how progress and effectiveness will be monitored (e.g., process review, audit, data trend).  
State when the next review is expected or what triggers a re-evaluation.]

## Acceptance / Verification
[Define what must be achieved for the risk to be considered controlled, mitigated, or closed.]
